comments.commentBody: Imagine if Hillary were to win the electoral college but loose the popular vote. A statistically remote possibility, sure, but interesting as a thought exercise. Certainly, Republicans, who were already prepared to treat her Presidency as illegitimate (as they have with Obama, despite his having won overwhelming popular and electoral victories). Forget impeachment - they would maintain that she should not be allowed to take the oath of office in the first place. Now, imagine what their reactions will be like if Trump wins the electoral college but looses the popular vote. Bet it would be quite a contrast.
You know, your 'thought exercise' actually happened in 2000, a mere sixteen years ago. Google "Gore wins the popular vote".
The Republicans will have to live with it, just as Democrats had to live with Gore winning the popular vote when Bush won the electoral college vote. It happens.

Isn't that what happened in 2001? Gore won the popular vote but lost the electoral college because of the Florida recount?

Yeah, it would be quite a contrast for Trump voters. Republicans would declare that this is a republic, not a democracy, and the electoral college kept it that way!

I do not disagree with Mr. Bruno's prognosis of tremendous challenges to come, but we've been here before and managed to survive.

When I was a young man, this Republic was metaphorically torn limb from limb by the bitter, bitter controversies engendered by the Vietnam war. The blood of anti-war protesters eventually flowed on US campuses while Richard Nixon's supporters cheered when they received word of the carnage.

Then, of course, we have the much earlier and much more dramatic example of America's bloodiest war: the Civil War. Quite close to where I live are the remains of the defensive earthworks known as Fort Stevens, one of the fortified positions that were created early in the conflict to keep Southern armies from entering Washington and burning it to the ground.

It was at Fort Stevens on July 11-12, 1864, that President Lincoln watched as Union troops repulsed the last Confederate invasion of the North.

The chances that any violence in the wake of the present election could match that which followed the election of Abraham Lincoln are almost infinitely small, but I would not be surprised if the blood shed after months of Trump's incitements to brutal deeds exceeded that of the Vietnam era.

Words are strange that way. If you charge them with hatred and use them often enough, they might as well be weapons firing off fatal projectiles. We shall soon see what Trump's wicked rhetoric has wrought, but we will never allow his attack on Americanism to succeed.

#L'Oss. You'll definitely see results with Drumpf:  internment camps, financial disaster (Why do you think markets tank whenever Drumpf gains in the polls?), international destabilization with a laughingstock in the White House, and the threat of military action whenever his fragile little child's ego is bruised. And if you think his tenure will be free of controversy then I've got a bridge in Brooklyn to sell you.
And this time, I would welcome their departure.

So true. We are living in a cold civil war, and the day Lee signed the surrender to Lincoln at Appomattox was Lincoln's "mission accomplished" moment. The confederacy has been fighting this battle ever since.

When I first started commenting a year ago, I was full of enthusiasm and hope for a Hillary victory. I still am- and can't imagine what the gov would be like under a Trump victory. With Donald, If the Rep maintain the House and Senate, they might get things done-- but Donald is not too popular with them; if the Dem get control even of one house, things will stall. If Hillary wins and the Dems get control of Congress things will get done, but if the Reps control one house, things stall. We all get the picture.

Over the course of the year, I feel as though I've been continually beaten. The vitriol and hate is overwhelming. Whereas I couldn't wait for Election Day to come, I now fear it as much as I want this to end.The hate and nastiness looms and feels like it will never end. Of course being a Dem, I feel so much coming from the other side- which I'm sure many on the other side would say about the Dems. The threat of violence and Donald's refusal to say IF he will accept the results (if it goes against him) just fuels the flames. We need to get past this.

We need a working Congress and a President who will work across the aisles, not leaders who threaten annihilation or stalemates.

Nov. 8 will be very anxiety provoking- maybe I'll watch The Walking Dead.

That money was funds that Iran sent to us in 1979 to buy fighter jets...which we never delivered...because of the ouster of the Shah. Iran sued us in The Hague and wanted 10 bill (interest included). Obama negotiated 1.7 bill. This did not happen on Obama's watch but he had to deal with it.
"We have not heard if Hillary will accept the results..."?
False equivalency alert!
Finally, Trump is a deeply flawed and frankly, despicable, person who I could never, ever cast my vote for. How any decent person can justify his rants I will never understand.
The republicans began their smear campaign against Hillary several years ago and literally brainwashed millions with false information. If the republicans had found anything on Hillary over that time do you think they would have just let her walk? Hearing after hearing; deposition after deposition; it was unending. The Clintons are smart but no one is perfect. If there was a smoking gun it would have been found. Just like the null result with Whitewater...after wasting 50 mill. Taxpayer dollars all they found was that a man lied about having an affair...under oath. What a Shakespearian tragedy! No man has ever stooped that low! The Republican nominee had how many affairs that he's denied? Let's put him under oath and see what we get.
Hillary stated very clearly in the debate where the candidates were asked if they would accept the outcome of the election if they were to lose that she would.

Sorry Oxford, your arguments don't work. Trump knows how to work with people? Really?- by stiffing workers and professionals he's worked with?stiffing investors? Declaring bankruptcies? (His hotel in Toronto just went under).

His knowledge of gov is nill. He is intellectually incurious and his advisers are scary human beings. He is temperamentally unsuited to be president, in my opinion. His hands near nuclear codes scares the bejesus out of a lot of gov people.

Like other lies tossed out by Trump and cohorts, Hillary is for vetting immigrants entering the country. Trump's charge to throw out all illegals is absurd (and costly). Mexico pay for the wall? Maybe in his next lifetime?

I will agree that one of Obama's failing was his inability to work with the Reps, but then Mitch McConnell and group vowing to obstruct him from the beginning was not a good sign.

So while there were mistakes made during the last 8 years, the election of Trump would be the biggest for the next four years.

As one who first campaigned for JFK, I have seen unfathomable at the time strides made with our ability to access and gather information. We have at our fingertips literally the knowledge of all the great libraries of the world. My concern is what we do with this vast array.

Were I to go back in time, armed with all I now know about JFK and Nixon, how might I react? How would all this newly acquired knowledge affect my thinking? Neither would measure up well in my estimation. Too much information about things that are not important clogs up the brain pan, interfere with one's analytical processes. How can I vote for JFK, now that Wikileaks shows evidence of his many extramarital indiscretions? Nixon seldom sleeps with his wife let alone go catting around with some floozies. Could he be the one?

I wonder, is that what matters? I'm a liberal who believes in principles Senator Kennedy (Kids, he was a liberal) is espousing. I go on believing such, thus voting for LBJ, HHH, McGovern, Carter, Mondale, Dukakis, Clinton, Gore, Kerry, Obama, and H. Clinton.

When it comes to politics I have long ago resigned myself to acknowledging that I am closed-minded. I continue to profess the beliefs of the Democratic Party. All the white noise which emanates from the mass media distorts more than it enlightens. I watch in amusement, and I ignore most of it. Campaigns are distractions, designed for folks who don't know what they think until they are told to.

DD
Manhattan

" LBJ"

He did more harm to our stable working class neighborhood in Detroit than any other president. A few years later, the death blow was a court order for school bussing in Detroit. Do you have this sort of program in NY City? It's my understanding your public schools are some of the most racially segregated in the US. I wouldn't thing such a progressive city would allow this to happen. Or maybe you don't think it's such a bad idea. Oh well, you're the liberal thinker.

LBJ got the Voting Rights Act passed and lost the South; he knew he would, but he did the right thing for the right reasons.  Clinton kept the peace and left a full treasury for "W" to squander on a trumped up war against those never found WMD's.  He also gave his "base" huge tax cuts.  Gore worked for the environment.  Kerry was a true war hero from his river boat patrols in Vietnam, later trashed by the Swift Boat liars who never served with him, or on those patrols.  JFK managed to craft a back door deal with Turkey and kept us out of a war with the Soviets in Cuba: we removed our armaments from Turkey's borders; the Soviets removed their missile silos from Cuba.  One and done.
Figurehead monarchies can work, yes, but it's way too late for the United States to get one of those. It's tempting, though.

Yeah, but would we, well, maybe elect our monarch? Can I volunteer for the lifetime job? What if the new monarch were like a *real* monarch who was all too often saying things like "Off with his head!" and "Throw him in the Tower!"

Nonetheless, I've always appreciated how Britain has its palace for the Queen, but a downtown condo for their prime minister. That nicely separates the pomp from the actual job of governing. Our own White House would make a great palace.

Unless we reinstate the one we had before 1776! Let's rejoin the Commonwealth, but as an independent Republic. Just put it to a plenescite/referendum, and make it effective in 2026! It actually might pass....

Everything described in this article about monarchy can be said about despotism. The former in modern times has however been stripped of all meaningful power and influence so to protect the people from its inherent bend towards absolute rule and cruel subjugation. The Monarchial figureheads of today are cute relics, but what would be their purpose in America?

I think there is an outside chance that Trump will win, perhaps with a comfortable margin.

I think that some white people are afraid that their answers may make pollsters think they are hostile to people of color. They are afraid that if they tell the pollster they are for Trump, the pollster will conclude they are bigots. Some whites are afraid that the pollster will retaliate against them. This might sound paranoid, but believe me: Many people are very afraid.

Cases In Point: In 1989, the Democratic candidate in the Virginia Governor's race, Doug Wilder, was black. Polls said he was about 18 points ahead. He won, but he won by a sliver. Some whites, I think, thought pollsters would think they were anti-black if they said they liked the Republican.

In 1989, and in 1993, Dinkins (black) contested Guilini (white) in the New York's Mayoral race. In both races Dinkins' numbers in the polls were better than his numbers on election day. (Incidentally, in 89, Dinkins won; in 93, Guiliani won.)

Of course, Hillary is not black. But Trump is identified with racism and Hillary has clung to Obama throughout this campaign.

Obama has gone to North Carolina on several occasions to boost Clinton's black vote. I wonder how many whites resent this and feel more compelled to vote for Trump.

NO body can win the presidency with less than 26 % of the african american vote..... the math just is not there and that is fact. There are not enough white people to overcome the need for the black vote or the latino vote.... stop kidding yourselves and look at the math.... math don't lie.
The Hispanic, Women and Black vote will push Hillary over the top. Hispanic early voting is well ahead of 2012.

If she is corrupt, what is he?? The "Mexican" judge did him the huge (or YUGE) favor of postponing the Trump "university" case until after the election; then there's the "foundation" he used to pay his own legal costs; then there's the sexual assaults and a rape case coming. She sent some emails. Gimme a break.

Please, do enlighten us on the "goodies" that have been promised as part of said "pandering" to minorities (who soon won't be minorities at all, but a growing majority)? Perhaps you mean fair shot of what every single white American counts as his or her birthright: fair and equal treatment under the law, equal access to decent schools and healthcare, a stable, decent paying job? I keep waiting in vain for an explanation from our Trump supporting brethren on why these Americans, your fellow citizens, must only get such things at the "expense" of white Americans, or why white Americans are any more deserving of them?

@L'Oss:  Surely you're rehearsing your monologue for some comedy club in Fair Verona.  Simply using the words "Trump" and "quiet maturity" in the same sentence will have them rolling in the aisles.  Oh, btw, if 70% of the U.S. sees the last eight years as a terribly-led nation being driven off a cliff by educated but angry, brittle progressives" what's our incumbent President doing with favorable ratings of over 50%?  Most of the angry people supporting The Donald are, in any case, rather less well-educated.

"An enlightened government needs to remedy the harms to middle-class left-behinds arising from globalization, the basis of income equality, and automation,"

You haven't been paying attention to some of the comments from Hillary supporters: The middle class who have been left behind just didn't care about updating their skills. They are just getting their comeuppance for years at cushy union jobs. Actually many of the same things were said by Republicans in the 1980s and 1990's. Those comments were labelled as greedy, mean spirited and "me generation".

If so, then the same applies to Hillary -- there is just the one old one. As Dowd suggests several Trumps, she also notes that we are hoping for a new, better Hillary. By this theory, we also must expect all of the past Hillary issues repeated in the Oval Office.

Unfortunately the Democrats are just as guilty of trying to privatize education. The Obama administration's (Arne Duncan) education policies were a disgrace to our public schools. No I'm not a Trump supporter!
With any luck, yes.

Just as those of us educated people who are NOT white or NOT Christian and NOT raised in families with significant wealth to preserve are voting for Hillary to defend ourselves from danger and economic and social discrimination, the White Christians from wealthy families are voting to preserve their wealth and power. Some of my acquaintance told me as early as 2010 pre-Romney that my dead parents were moochers off Social Security, unlike their richer dead parents. When i noted that both my parents worked & paid the maximum into SS from 1935-1980, they said my parents were moochers off Medicare. There's a group of wealthy educated people who hold educated white middle class people who work in CONTEMPT  because they are not wealthy. The wealthy will always vote Republican because no matter who is president, their interests will be paramount.

You think the saying "Barbarians are at the gate of Rome" is old? But here they are. 

We learned how to lie on live TV (and fanatically believe those lies), how to kill more efficiently (and argue that we need to have more weapons for self-defence) and how to tweet in our sleep...

Even though our civilization underwent significant evolution the average human brain remains at the stimulus-response level of a Pavlov's dog. Are we really THAT dumb? Just ask Trump and his supporters about it. 

Without PROPER education and guidance from the early childhood we are just as dumb as they come. I cannot emphasize this strong enough but proper education is crucial, and I mean crucial - not just to our success but to our survival.

Earlier in the Presidential race Jeb Bush was asked whether he would kill baby Hitler? “Hell yeah, I would!” said Bush. But does it really matter?  If after the most atrocious and despicable war in human history we cannot learn a lesson (could we ever!) something must be wrong with our heads. 

I would love to see what America could become with Bernie as a President. Idealist vs Pragmatist vs Demagogue (or to say it another way: Mr. Nice Guy vs Bada$$ vs ... just A$$$$). After 8 years of Republican obstructionism, witch hunt, bigotry and other "stuff", which cannot be described in dry language, did we learn our History lesson? ...What lesson?

We are not Canada, nor Denmark.  We are a capitalist country founded on property ownership.  We have progressed from that beginning; however, we have not changed the fundamentals.  Bernie was an Independent Socialist until he became a come to Jesus Democrat.  Hillary has been a Democrat for decades; she has served, worked hard for families, women and children.  She has never stopped fighting for what she believes in: public service.  I don't know where Bernie thought he was going to get funding for his platform.  And, his rants got repetitive.  He will now support Clinton and campaign for her.  She will become the next President, and she will work  hard as she always does.  She is a policy wonk, and I think that is a good thing.  No surprises, just a steady hand at the helm.  As far as what she can do with a corrupt, gerrymandered Congress, not much.  She will do her best, as she always has done.

If Trump wins, as I now fear he will, I will not question the legitimacy of the result for it will have been the decision of the American electorate. I will however assume that having the FBI acting in a manner highly favorable to Trump had a great deal to do with the result. I hope you can understand that such a position is not the same as claiming the election was somehow "rigged".

And when the FBI refused to say that there was sufficient evidence for Hillary to be prosecuted? Will you also assume that having the FBI acting in a manner highly favorable to Clinton had an even greater deal to do with the result as well?
I doubt any candidate regards an FBI investigation as helpful to their campaign.

I link many of these comments together. White males have recently had to give up the monopoly on political power that they had since the nation's origin. The disappearance of manufacturing jobs (and lack of meaningful work), and the disastrous concentration of wealth add to their feeling of powerlessness. White males' life expectancy has actually declined in recent years (see drugs replacing meaningful work). The resulting anger Trump taps into, and voices, is deep and visceral.
The uneducated are relieved to have it voiced, and believe, since he's a rich man, he must know what he's talking about. The Trump-leaning women are in the networks of angry white men. I don't think you can find a Trump-voting women who hangs with a Hillary-supporting male. They want a simpler time. The educated know Trump does not have the answers, and find his spurning of expertise truly scary.

Frank, spot on - unfortunately. For the longest time I couldn't understand how so many people could look at the facts about Trump and say they're voting for him anyway. The standard explanation that HRC has been rendered toxic by both her behavior and the GOP propaganda crusade didn't ring true. Although that's certainly a factor, the deeper truth is that so many among us are Trumpian at heart:  bigoted, ignorant and proud of it.  If Bernie or anyone else were the Democratic nominee, the GOP playbook would still be the same: character assassination, Trumped-up charges, innuendo, vilification, threats of impeachment, email hacks, dog whistles, scare tactics, intimations of violence, voter intimidation, promises to paralyze government. None of this will change on November 9th. November 8th isn't the end; it's the horrible beginning and we have the GOP to thank.

Excellent comment. I would make one correction: Although the GOP is a factor, there is one clear and undeniable reality: The population of the United States is extremely stupid. Pull no punches, people, americans are very very very stupid. Nobody with half a brain could possibly buy the Trump nonsense and ignore the fact that he is a horrible human being. The chickens have come home to roost, and there is a price to pay, no matter who wins the election. It is a Nation of Nitwits.

"Bigoted, ignorant, and proud of it." This is the 2016 election. I have posted comments to this newspaper, the WaPo, and spoken with acquaintances. I have scoffed that people do not read books. They not only do not care, they are proud of it. I have mentioned a lack of education; "Advanced degrees (even an undergraduate degree) are for 'elites'", they reply. Fact remains, many people still cannot fathom a Harvard educated black man. Really. Even though that was an eight year ago topic. The basket of deploables is a shrinking demographic. But it exists. The media is not blameless. But until recently they did not label lies as lies.

I heard Trump read from the Brietbart teleprompter just last night. Lie after lie. Yet CNN, MSNBC and others played it as if it were normal. The Earth is actually older than 7000 years or so. Clinton Cash is not a book. Science is not evil. The bad news, and sadly I do not have a solution, is that deplorables (like your fellow breakfast patron) only converse with other deplorables in person, on Facebook, and on their ever present phones.

I used to go to Starbucks and people were reading, or had laptops open, or were studying. Now they are texting. Alas, they are texting others who do not challenge them.
Thats exactly how I feel about Obama.  How could people be so stupid to elect this idiot once is bad.  But, twice is just stupid as it gets.

This summer my family and I attended a Lakewood (New Jersey) Blue Claws game and sat in outdoor skybox seats behind and to the right of home plate. We were above the net that provided some protection to the fans in the seats below, from the front but not from overhead. I admonished my six-year-old son to pay attention at all times and I did the same. A foul ball hit the box next to us hard. Maybe a dozen went over the net and smacked into the concession area where hundreds of people were walking and dozens worked, and they would surely not be watching the game - only luck kept them safe. In one instance a fouled back ball went over the net, hit the stadium wall and bounced back into the seats below, hitting a young child in the back of the head. He and his distraught mother were escorted out. I spent so much time being super-vigilant and my son was so worried that it took most of the enjoyment out of the day. He has no desire to go to another baseball game and I won't be taking him.

People of the (not so) United states of America will lose no matter who wins. The controversies will not go away. Atleast Obama was less prone to blunders as Clinton is and if she wins, they will not let her rule. So folks, 4 more years of fighting in the senate. If Trump wins, I cannot say because I do not know what he plans to do. But an increased racism is for sure.
This has more to do about gender than race. Men in general will not vote for a woman in large numbers, especially a corrupt one. There goes the white privilege trope. Trump wins comfortably.

Trump is just trolling for his Nazi magic and depending on henchmen Lewandowski and Giuliani.  Trump is our lowest nature squared.  He will destroy America if he can.  Take down NATO.  Steal hand over fist any cash he can get his hands on.  Trolls have been gaming live polls for Trump this whole cycle.  This is part of the Putin Puppet regimen.

Yes, once you destroy an the Old World Order, you are supposed to have a New World Order to replace it with.  In this case, there is nothing to replace it with except Trump and Putin, not USA and Russia leading to a new social contract, but Trump and Putin.  Perhaps Mr. Trump fantasizes himself and Pres. Putin as something out of the old WCW/WWE story line.  If that's the case, then this is further evidence that he and his core supporters can't see the difference between fiction and reality.  This is the real world you are staging your melodrama in, Mr. Trump. The set is earth and the actors whose fate you alone want to decide, everyone on it.  To view the presidency as a position of such power is not consistent with our long-held ideals.  To take such a responsibility frivolously and selfishly, as you do, is an act of infamy, even if you lose and never see the inside of the White House again.

Yup, just like Romney 2012. The polls are rigged or they have under/over-represented some hidden constituency. And only a chosen few are able to see through the smoke and subterfuge and know that their candidate is going to win by a landslide.
What makes you think blacks and latinos aren't blue-collar?
I advise you not to follow "your feeling", which will be be proved how off it is in 3 days. Maybe you are talking about your wish.

Not at all. White people have gotten unfair advantages in every sector of our economy just for being white. They get paid more for the same work, more likely to be hired, punished less for the same crime, get better rate loans etc. You name it, and white people have gotten it. This is starting to change. If you don't like it, tough.
